intro: Parthenoxylon, commonly known as the ghost gum, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark that peels in thin, flaky layers. The tree has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the branches. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters, and it produces woody, oval-shaped fruits. Parthenoxylon is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species adapted to harsh climatic conditions.
